thread.title: UR renames entrepreneurship center after $5M donation
thread.title_full: UR renames entrepreneurship center after $5M donation

author: democratandchronicle.com
title: UR renames entrepreneurship center after $5M donation
text:
Mark and Carolyn Ain have donated $5 million to the University of Rochester's Center for Entrepreneurship. Because of that donation, the university has renamed it the Ain Center for Entrepreneurship . Mark Ain, who graduated with a master's of business administration from UR in 1967, is the former chairman and CEO of Kronos Inc., a company he founded in 1977.
UR already has Mark Ain's name on other entrepreneurs activities on campus. At the Mark Ain Business Model Competition, undergraduate and graduate students can present their business models to a panel of judges. The center also holds the Mark Ain Workshop Series.
Mark Ain also sits on UR's governing board.
KJBROOKS@Gannett.com
